summary: This is a Radar Online article from October 25, 2007, summarizing amended lawsuit allegations against Jeffrey Epstein and Leslie Wexner. The article details graphic sexual misconduct claims by a plaintiff, including allegations that Epstein used the allure of Victoria's Secret to entrap young models and that Wexner knowingly allowed this. The document appears to be a fax from the Palm Beach Police Department containing the article.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary defendant in a lawsuit alleging sexual misconduct, accused of using Victoria's Secret to lure young models and engage in abusive acts.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Named as a defendant in the lawsuit, accused of knowingly allowing Epstein to use Victoria's Secret to harass and trap young models.

persons.name: William Unroch
persons.context: Described as the plaintiff's attorney and former boyfriend, who commented to Radar about the case.

persons.name: Tyler Grey
persons.context: Listed as the editor of the Radar Online article.

persons.name: Sarah Ham Raymond
persons.context: Listed as a contributor to the Radar Online article.

connections.description: Lawsuit alleges Wexner knowingly allowed Epstein to use Victoria's Secret to lure models for sexual acts.
Unroch is the attorney for the plaintiff suing Epstein.

events.title: Lawsuit Amended with New Allegations
events.description: A plaintiff amended her lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein and Leslie Wexner, adding new graphic allegations of sexual misconduct.

locations: Nine East 71 Street Corporation (likely Epstein's New York residence)
keyFacts: The article reports amended lawsuit allegations accusing Jeffrey Epstein of using Victoria's Secret's glamour to 'harass and trap young models and teenage girls in performing sex acts'.
Leslie Wexner, head of Victoria's Secret, is named as a defendant for allegedly 'knowingly allowing' Epstein to use the brand for this purpose.
Specific graphic allegations are detailed, including Epstein wearing lipstick and a wig, making comments about transgender models, and ejaculating into the plaintiff's mouth.
The plaintiff's attorney, William Unroch, stated his client was never a man, countering claims, and that Epstein acknowledged her 'extreme makeover'.
The document is a fax from the Palm Beach Police Department dated October 25, 2007, containing the media article, suggesting law enforcement interest in the allegations.
